title: Vector Addition
text: Calculate the $$x$$ vector and $$y$$ vector lengths for Vectors A and B to find the total length of the resulting vector R using pythagorean theorem.

title: Trigonometry
text: Solve $$12cos\left(70\right)+20cos\left(40\right)$$ where $$12cos\left(70\right)$$ is the $$x$$ vector length for vector A and $$20cos\left(40\right)$$ is the $$x$$ vector length for vector B. Solve $$20sin\left(40\right)-12sin\left(70\right)$$ where $$12sin\left(70\right)$$ is the $$y$$ vector length for vector A and $$20sin\left(40\right)$$ is the $$y$$ vector length for vector B. Now use pythagorean theorem for the total length.
